column4: joiningtheheard: I mounted it, but it said I do not have permission to view the contents under d2 (which is what I named the folder)
Please tell me I didn't just make 200 gigs worth of data useless...
run mount with no options to check to make sure the disk is mounted where you think it is.  then if it is run 'ls -l /media' to see who owns it and the permissions
It says /dev/sdb1 on /media/d2 type ntfs (rw)
Understood, running them now.  But I think it's telling me I can't do it cause after each thing it's saying "Read-only file system"
Couldn't change the permissions of "d2" because it is on a read-only disk
No idea what you mean.  I ran both of those commands you told me but nothing has changed.  It keeps acting like the disk is Read only
mount | grep sdb
/dev/sdb1 on /media/d2 type ntfs (rw)
But I don't know what it means or how to change it so that I can see the contents and what not.
What does it mean?  The rw means readable & writable right?
Again you're talking over my level of technical competency.  Either way, what would be the next step to making this capable of being read and edited?

Ok.  But before I unmounted this drive I could at least see the files.  I couldn't delete them, but I could see them.  Now I can't even see them.  The data is there because when you had me run those 2 commands it was attempting to preform actions on all of the files.  Yet, I still cannot see them.
Yeah, but I can't see them.   Much less edit or delete them.
I don't know what Edgy is.
I am new to Linux & Ubuntu.
I don't even know what Edgy is.
I'm assuming it is an older version of Ubuntu, but I don't know.  This fiesty is the first version I've ever tried.
No, I don't even know what X server is.
Yeah, Ubuntu
*sigh*  I don't even know what that means.  All I want to do is mount this drive and be able to use the data on it.
